H0.text: Seed and pollen are the two major innovations that allowed seed plants to reproduce in the absence of water.

H1.text: Bee and pollen are the two major innovations that allowed seed plants to reproduce in the absence of water.

H2.text: Root and pollen are the two major innovations that allowed seed plants to reproduce in the absence of water.

H3.text: Salt and pollen are the two major innovations that allowed seed plants to reproduce in the absence of water.

A4.text: It is suspected that the extension was involved in anemophilous (wind) pollination.
